metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4577 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A certain Debian patch for GNU GRUB uses world-readable permissions forgrub.cfg, which allows local users to obtain password hashes, asdemonstrated by reading the password_pbkdf2 directive in the file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-common - 2.00-20
grub-coreboot - 2.00-20
grub-coreboot-bin - 2.00-20
grub-efi - 2.00-20
grub-efi-amd64 - 2.00-20
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.00-20
grub-efi-arm - 2.00-20
grub-efi-arm-bin - 2.00-20
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.00-20
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.00-20
grub-efi-ia32 - 2.00-20
grub-efi-ia32-bin - 2.00-20
grub-emu - 2.00-20
grub-firmware-qemu - 2.00-20
grub-ieee1275 - 2.00-20
grub-ieee1275-bin - 2.00-20
grub-linuxbios - 2.00-20
grub-pc - 2.00-20
grub-pc-bin - 2.00-20
grub-rescue-pc - 2.00-20
grub-theme-starfield - 2.00-20
grub-uboot - 2.00-20
grub-uboot-bin - 2.00-20
grub-xen - 2.00-20
grub-xen-bin - 2.00-20
grub-xen-host - 2.00-20
grub2 - 2.00-20
grub2-common - 2.00-20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.00-20').
